div.p:
Your kind letter assured me of what re-
quired required small assurance that my dear little Jane will
find warm hearts and open arms to receive her at
Edgeworthstown. She is a little body that has wrought
herself about my affections very intimately from a
leal truth of character which she shewed showed in the whole
of our proceedings during this affair. By the bye there is
now no law. Her mother was quite subdued and seclu
=ded secluded and her daughter has behaved to her with very
great generosity adding to her income the means of
keeping a carriage if she likes it that she may
not feel herself the less for parting with her daughter
The Gods have not much I am poetical and I believe
Walter likes the letter for he would rather read Euclid
than Homer and rather poke a military friend off his
horse with a real lance than read of Britomarte &
Bradamante with their enchanted spears. Britomartis was a Greek goddess of mountains and hunting, while Bradamante was a female warrior in Orlando Furioso.On my
part I am required that sure the gods here with

withhold that born the Devil has not supplied the void
with the affectation of that which exists not for a pinch=
beck pinchbeck taste was ever my dread and detestation - if I can=
not cannot have a gold watch a silver one will serve my turn.

You will soon know more of her than I can for ladies
are capital at tracing out each others characters which
are rather too evanescent for us. They were married on 3d
feby. and came here to reside quite for a little. Since
I joined them on the 10th we have seen the Scotts of Harden
and the Fergusons and my little landlady did the
honours honors of her chateau with very pretty embarrassment embarrassment . My
wife was detained by a bad cold we join them in Edinburgh
tomorrow and in four or five days afterwards set out
for London and then for Green Erin I conceive they will
be at Edgeworthstown about the 2d but Walter will write
so soon as he has his foot on the sod. I could have wished
to have kept them longer here for Jane seemed to take very
kindly some trifling lists I gave her and I am sure I
could have cured some of her little deficiencies in the
usage du Monde as she shewed showed great readiness and
good humour humor & shrewdness to catching a hint this
however in good society is easily acquired. I am greatly
indebted to Mrs Edgeworths extreme kindness in of=
=fering offering such a desirable place of refuge for my little wan
=derers wanderers . They leave us on Monday next and their stay in
Lon
don London
will be only to make a few emplettes of which household
matters they want for the campaign amongst other things the
necessary burthen of a travelling traveling carriage. I conceive they
will be at Edgeworthstown about the 20 March as he will be
under the necessity of joining his regiment at
Corke Cork
on the
24 at the very latest and I hope he will be wise enough not to
run himself to a day. I observe I said this before but that is
because I began my letter at Abbotsford and am concluding
it in Edinburgh. Walter and rides in the country look
up a great deal of our leisure and hope there are visits of
congratulation to be returned and the lord knows what.

Remember me kindly to your brother the gallant engineer
If he is at home he will find Walter something in his size
as I before hinted. He suffers a good deal under the attentions
often paid him by strangers as the son of a literary person
& considers receiving them as a taking of money under
false pretences pretenses . I trust his wife and he will draw each other
a little out for both are bashful. She in despite of lands &
tenements and he notwithstanding moustaches mustache and
schnur-bart.
